name: "DBC Research Ticket Template Kit - 01: Create ReadMe file in GitHub"
about: To guide the creation of a ReadMe file which will will serve as a quick reference for the files and folders related to a DBC research study.
title: Create ReadMe file in GitHub
labels: "disability-benenfits,research" 
assignees: ''

---

> [!NOTE] 
> If you have any recommended changes to this ticket template, contact a DBC designer. Otherwise, remove this notice when creating your ticket.

### Description
Create a Github folder and Read Me file for the [study name here] study. The study focuses on [brief description of study].

The Read Me file will serve as a quick reference for the files and folders related to the study. Links should be added to the Read Me as the study progresses. Links typically include:

**Main folders:**
- Folder for draft documents
- Research folder on GitHub
- Study folder on SharePoint _(optional)_

**Research planning artifacts:**
- Ticket in the VA.gov Research Repository
- Research approach _(optional)_
- Research plan
- Conversation guide _(study-dependent)_
- Prototype _(study-dependent)_

**Research raw materials:**
- Research recordings, transcripts, and notes on SharePoint

**Research summation artifacts:**
- Field observations _(optional)_
- Synthesis Tools (for example, a Mural)
- VA recruitment checker for equality
- Final report
- Presentation PDF _(optional)_

#### Suggested timeframe for this ticket
This ticket should take well under a single sprint.

### Tasks
- [ ] Create a research folder in your online collaboration tool of choice to store work in progress. If using Google drive:
   - [ ] Navigate to the appropriate folder in which you’d like to create your research folder within the VA DBC - team Google Drive (eg: VA DBC team > [Conditions and Evidence Workstream](https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/124zVlrtTNcVFFUm4EA1MiLaYLmrckRA3?usp=drive_link) > [Research](https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1wVOYwuU-BGIEblUkazINYZwU9BdFoD9p?usp=drive_link))
   - [ ] Create a new folder that mirrors the title of your research (eg: 2025-11 Supplemental claims design directions)
   - [ ] Store any and all documents related to this research initiative within this folder. Especially useful for in-progress draft work that’s collaboratively developed.
- [ ] Create a research folder on GitHub according to instructions in the [Research Checklist](https://depo-platform-documentation.scrollhelp.site/research-design/research-checklist#Researchchecklist-Writingyourresearchplan) (review section 1. Plan > Writing your research plan > Research Folder Example).
- [ ] Create a folder for recordings on SharePoint:
   - [ ] In the [Benefits Portfolio](https://dvagov.sharepoint.com/sites/vaabdvro/Shared%20Documents/Forms/AllItems.aspx?viewid=3fa7a9bb%2D3d4e%2D44c2%2Db93f%2D629268a08e72&csf=1&web=1&e=r7urXZ&CID=eb2456e3%2D0585%2D45a1%2Da0c3%2Df9e9972441bc&FolderCTID=0x01200073ECFC0A16DB51439C06C6FDC0E92947) SharePoint, navigate to [0 - Benefits Portfolio - General](https://dvagov.sharepoint.com/sites/vaabdvro/Shared%20Documents/Forms/AllItems.aspx?id=%2Fsites%2Fvaabdvro%2FShared%20Documents%2F0%20%2D%20Benefits%20Portfolio%20%2D%20General&viewid=3fa7a9bb%2D3d4e%2D44c2%2Db93f%2D629268a08e72&csf=1&web=1&e=r7urXZ&CID=eb2456e3%2D0585%2D45a1%2Da0c3%2Df9e9972441bc&FolderCTID=0x01200073ECFC0A16DB51439C06C6FDC0E92947) > [Research Recordings - Veteran-Staff-VSO](https://dvagov.sharepoint.com/sites/vaabdvro/Shared%20Documents/Forms/AllItems.aspx?id=%2Fsites%2Fvaabdvro%2FShared%20Documents%2F0%20%2D%20Benefits%20Portfolio%20%2D%20General%2FResearch%20Recordings%20%2D%20Veteran%2DStaff%2DVSO&viewid=3fa7a9bb%2D3d4e%2D44c2%2Db93f%2D629268a08e72&csf=1&web=1&e=r7urXZ&CID=eb2456e3%2D0585%2D45a1%2Da0c3%2Df9e9972441bc&FolderCTID=0x01200073ECFC0A16DB51439C06C6FDC0E92947)
   - [ ] Create a folder for your study’s recordings and transcripts in the Research Recordings folder using the following naming convention: YYYY-MM Study Name (eg: 2025-11 526EZ Supplemental Claims Design Direction)
   - [ ] For your transcripts and recordings, use the following naming conventions: P##-transcript-YYYY-MM-DD or P##-recording-YYYY-MM-DD, the numbers being your participant’s identifying number (eg: P01-transcript-2025-11-26)
- [ ] Create a folder for reports and related materials in your team’s folder SharePoint _(optional)_. Use this if you need to store files, such as presentations, in Microsoft Office formats.

### Acceptance criteria
- [ ] The GitHub folder, ReadMe file, SharePoint recordings folder, and draft document folder are created
